ARABIC: يَٰقَوْمِ إِنَّمَا هَٰذِهِ ٱلْحَيَوٰةُ ٱلدُّنْيَا مَتَٰعٌ وَإِنَّ ٱلْءَاخِرَةَ هِىَ دَارُ ٱلْقَرَارِ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: My people! the life of this world is only fleeting enjoyment. It is the Next World which is the abode of permanence.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: O people, the life of this world is ephemeral; but enduring is the abode of the Hereafter.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: My people, the life of this world is ephemeral, whereas the Hereafter, that is the permanent abode.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: My people, this worldly life is only the means (to an end), but the life hereafter will be the everlasting abode.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: “O my people! The life of this world is just a brief usage, and indeed the next abode is one of everlasting stay.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: O my people! Truly, this life of the world is nothing but an enjoyment, and verily, the Hereafter that is the home that will remain forever."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: O my people! this life of the world is only a (passing) enjoyment, and surely the hereafter is the abode to settle;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: O my people, surely this present life is but a passing enjoyment; surely the world to come is the abode of stability.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: O my people! Lo! this life of the world is but a passing comfort, and lo! the Hereafter, that is the enduring home.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: O my people, the life of this world is only a temporary provision; and the Hereafter is the permanent abode.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: O My people! this life of the world Is but a possi enjoyment, and verily the Hereafter! that is the Abode of rest.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: O my people! This life of the world is only a [passing] enjoyment, and indeed the Hereafter is the abiding home.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: O my people! This life of the present is nothing but (temporary) convenience: It is the Hereafter that is the Home that will last.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: O my people! Truly, this life of the world is nothing but a (quick passing) enjoyment, and verily, the Hereafter that is the home that will remain forever."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: O my nation, the life of this world is nothing but an enjoyment, but surely, the life of the Everlasting Life is the stable abode.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: “O my people, the life of this world is nothing but fleeting enjoyment, but the Hereafter is the Home of Permanence.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: O my people, this worldly life is only [temporary] enjoyment, and indeed, the Hereafter - that is the home of [permanent] settlement.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [40:39] O my people! Truly this life of the world is only an [ephemeral] enjoyment, [containing] comforts which will [eventually] disappear, whereas the Hereafter truly is the enduring abode.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (O my people! Lo! this life of the world is but a passing comfort) like the comfort of your homes; it does not last, (and lo! the Hereafter) i.e. the Garden, (that is the enduring home) that is the everlasting abode which will never perish.
